Ref: OM dated 17.03.2020 & 22.03.2020 of DoPT Government has issued instructions in above cited OMs of DoPT dated 17.03.2020 & 22.03.2020 (copies enclosed), which  may be followed. The essential/ emergency services in the context of NHA, may include safe operation & maintenance of highways, toll plazas, construction zones, etc. These may be ensured: 2 _ The operation of Toll Plazas may be continued with required/ skeletal staff by providing adequate safety measures for toll operators like   masks, gloves, goggles, sanitizers, facility for hand washing, etc: The hygiene at Toll Booths & public utilities on highways (like toilets, Hi-way Nest, Side Amenities, etc:) may be ensured & these places may be sanitized frequently. 3 ETC transactions at toll plazas should be ensured unhindered. 4_ Actions required to pr tect the interest of Govt/ NHAI may be ensured. All essential/ necessary works which are time bound  should be acted upon & decided without   delay. Those which are routine, where postponement does not involve any adverse effect, may be postponed, if CGM at HQ RO/PD decide so. 5_ In case of bids, the evaluation process may be continued by exchange of e-mails. The members of Evaluation Committee, Bidder' s &  Consultant's Representatives may attend in the process of evaluation through Video Conference/ Skypel other similar facilities. 6 _ Special precautions may be taken in case of lockdown districts and states as per directions of local administrat:on: 7_ Above examples are illustrative only, but not exhaustive. PDIRO may take appropriate decisions keeping in view the local situation and the   spirit of above instructions. If required, they may consult Member concerned. Mt M M M NHAI 23rd Way
